title: 820-3462 no green light
message:
820-3462

No green light. Light liquid damage. to pp3v42 area 



R6920 + R6905 burnt.
Replaced these. 

PP18V5_DCIN_CONN 2.3v
PPVIN_G3H_P3V42G3H 1.1v

pp3v42 = 0.008v

Replaced:
C6992
C6991
C69901
R6995
R6996
C6994
q6910
c6995
c6999
u6990  
u6900

PPVIN_G3H_P3V42G3H diode mode to ground0.35v
pp3v42 diode mode to ground 0.305v

Got lost on this one now would appreciate any help.

title: 820-3462 no green light
message: 0.3 is fine so there is no short. R6905 burned for a reason so check voltages at D6905 and U6990.

title: 820-3462 no green light
message:
Thank you duke.


d6905 
pin1 0.68v
pin2 0v (no battery connected)
pin3 0.67v




d6990

pin1 0.007
pin2 0.007
pin3 0.003
pin4 0.004
pin5 0
pin6 0.635
pin7 0.044
pin8 0.635

The probe point next to C6991 looks bad so i ran a wire from D6905 to C6991 and C6992 but this didn't change anything. continuity checked out.
possible that PPVIN_G3H_P3V42G3H leaking through the probe point ?

title: 820-3462 no green light
message: I assume you checked R6920. So it seems Q6910 is not opening, voltages there?

title: 820-3462 no green light
message:
Thanks Duke,

Yes R6920 was initially burnt and was replaced.


q6910
pin 5/6 2.36v
pin 4 0.7v
pin 1/2/3 0.657v

replaced q6910 again in case donor board duff - no change.


R6910 99k
r6911 10.1k
r6912 68k
all measure within spec.

replaced c6912
R6910 
R6911

no change

I concur that Q6910 is not opening but i don't know what else would cause it not to.

Thanks again.

title: 820-3462 no green light
message: Again I ask for voltages on Q6910.

title: 820-3462 no green light
message:
Q6910
pin 5/6 2.36v
pin 4 0.7v
pin 1/2/3 0.657v

these were in the above post.

title: 820-3462 no green light
message:
Oops sorry didn't see that.
So the charger is shutting down/not turning on. Try with a Chinese charger or an external power supply hooked up to the magsafe connector. This will bypass the protection circuit in the original charger.

title: 820-3462 no green light
message: Chinese charger gets green light and machine boots. Still nothing with original 85w - worth pursuing or just supplying chinese charger ?

title: 820-3462 no green light
message: There is probably an issue around U7000 or Q7080. Check all current sense resistors and traces to Q7080.
